data.title: George Foreman Evolve Grill Recipes | How to Make Homemade Deep Dish Pizza
data.description:
Pizza is even better when it's homemade! This Deep Dish Pizza is sure to be a favorite. Serve fresh off your George Foreman Evolve Grill and enjoy! 

Deep Dish Pizza

Prep Time: 10 minutes
Total Time: 30 minutes
Servings: 6

Ingredients:
1 package refrigerated classic pizza crust, 13.8 oz.
1 c. bottled or prepared marinara sauce
2 c. Mozzarella cheese
½ c. Parmesan & Romano cheese
½ c. pepperoni, sliced

Directions:
1. Remove pizza crust from package and press into bottom and sides of the baking plate.
2. Spread marinara sauce on bottom crust. Top with cheese and pepperoni.
3. Place plate into bottom of the Evolve Grill
4. Preheat the grill.
5. Close the grill cover and bake for 20 minutes or until crust is golden and cheese is melted and browned.
6. Using pot holders, remove plate from grill and place on trivet or cooling rack. Use nylon spatula to remove pizza from plate.

Plates needed: Top Grilling Plate; Bottom Bake Plate
Preheat temperature: High

data.title: George Foreman Removable Plate Grill Recipes | How to Make a Provolone Prosciutto Panini
data.description:
Let the comfort food cooking for fall begin! This Provolone Prosciutto Panini on your George Foreman Removable Plate Grill is perfect for your next soup and sandwich combination or dinner at home.

Provolone Prosciutto Panini

Ingredients:
4 thick slices Italian Bread
Olive oil
2 tablespoon prepared pesto
4 ounces thinly sliced prosciutto
½ cup packaged roasted tomatoes
4 ounces provolone cheese

Directions:
1. Brush one side of each slice of bread with olive oil.
2. Place the bread, olive oil brushed sides down, onto the cutting board or work surface.
3. Spread pesto on the slices of bread. Top with prosciutto, tomatoes and provolone cheese.
4. Cover with remaining 2 slices of bread; oiled side out.
5. Cook on preheated grill for about 4 minutes or until the bread is golden and cheese is melted.
6. Cut in half and serve warm.
7. Posted by George Foreman Cooking at 11:48 AM

data.title: George Foreman Indoor/Outdoor Grill Recipes | How to Make Tasty Grilled Potato Skewers
data.description:
The Indoor/Outdoor Grill makes these Grilled Potato Skewers from George Foreman Cooking perfect for your next cookout or dinner inside! Similar to a fully loaded baked potatoes; these skewered appetizers are simple and delicious. They are a perfect appetizer for feeding hungry crowds at parties, potlucks or dinners. 

Grilled Potato Skewers

Prep Time: 10 minutes
Cook Time: 20 minutes
Total Time: 30 minutes
Yield: 6 servings

Ingredients:

12 mini new white potatoes (about 1 1/2-inches each)
12 mini new red potatoes (about 1 1/2-inches each)
4 green onions, cut into 1-inch pieces
2 tbsp vegetable oil
1/2 tsp salt
1/4 tsp freshly ground pepper
3/4 cup shredded Tex-Mex blend cheese
1 cup sour cream

Directions:

Cook potatoes in salted boiling water for 12 to 15 minutes or until just tender. Cool completely. Preheat your George Foreman Indoor/Outdoor Grill for 5 minutes on highest setting with the lid closed.

Meanwhile, toss potatoes with oil and season with salt and pepper. Thread, alternating white and red potatoes with green onion pieces on each skewer.

Place on grill and cook, covered, turning occasionally, for 8 to 10 minutes or until potatoes are well marked and hot throughout and green onion are slightly charred. Remove from grill and immediately sprinkle with cheese so it melts. Serve with sour cream for dipping.

Tip: Substitute cheddar cheese for the Tex-Mex blend cheese, if desired.

data.title: George Foreman Removable Plate Grill Recipes | How to Make Turkey Burgers with Grilled Fries
data.description:
Summer is perfect for grilling burgers! Try this Cheeseburger with Grilled Fries for a healthier take on a classic meal off the 6-Serving Removable Plate GRP1001BP from George Foreman Grills.

Turkey Burger with Grilled Fries

Ingredients:
3 ounces lean ground turkey
Cheddar cheese slices (if desired)
1 cup vegetables of your choice: Tomato, onion, lettuce
1 hamburger bun
2 Tablespoons ketchup and/or mustard (optional)
1 small potato, cut into wedges
2 teaspoon canola oil
1/8 teaspoon salt & pepper

Directions:
1. Preheat your George Foreman® grill to max setting.
2. Toss potato in canola oil, salt and pepper and grill for 10 to 12 minutes.
3. Form turkey into a patty and grill for 3 to 4 minutes.
4. Assemble burger with bun, vegetables, cheddar cheese, ketchup/mustard and enjoy with baked fries.

data.title: George Foreman Evolve Grill Recipes | How to Make Quick and Easy Blueberry Muffins
data.description:
Make your mornings extra special with these easy-to-make, homemade Blueberry Muffins on your George Foreman Evolve Grill! They're perfect for breakfast or brunch.

Blueberry Muffins

Prep Time: 10 minutes
Cooking Time: 45 minutes
Total Time: 55 minutes
Servings: 16

Ingredients:
1 ¾ cups flour
1/3 cup sugar
2 tsp. baking powder
¼ tsp. salt
1 egg, beaten
¾ cup milk
¼ cup cooking oil
1 tsp. vanilla
¾ cup blueberries
1 tsp. lemon zest

Directions:
1. Preheat the Evolve Grill to 400° and grease the muffin pan.
2. In a medium size bowl, whisk together the flour, sugar, baking powder and salt. Set aside.
3. In a small bowl, whisk together the egg, milk, oil and vanilla.
4. Make a well in the center of the dry ingredients and pour in the wet ingredients. Mix together until combined. The batter will be thick.
5. Fold in the blueberries and lemon zest.
6. Fill the muffin pan 2/3 full with batter and place in the baking dish. Bake for 13-15 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted comes out clean. Place on a wire rack to cool.
7. Repeat with the remaining batter.
8. Serve warm with butter.

asset.author: George Foreman Cooking
